content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 79.29 - Operation of vehicles in the air operations areas restricted

State Regulations
(a) Ramp speed
limits. Speed limits for all types of motorized vehicles and equipment shall
be: (1)
around aircraft - five miles per
hour; (2)
fire lanes and access
roads - 15 miles per hour; and
(3)
taxiways - 35 miles per hour. Snow removal equipment and emergency response vehicles
shall be exempt from these speed limits during snow removal operations and
required emergency responses. (b) All vehicles operating in the air
operations areas of the airport shall be equipped with a functioning two-way
radio capable of communicating on the proper aeronautical frequencies and shall
obtain a clearance from the airport air traffic control tower before entry
thereon. Vehicles used on a regular basis in the air operations areas of the
airport shall be painted in a manner approved by the airport operator and be
equipped with an approved amber rotating or flashing beacon on the roof or
uppermost point of the vehicle. After obtaining permission of the airport
operator, vehicles used on an irregular basis in or upon the airport shall
proceed directly to their destination and shall have in operation the flashing
parking lights. Notes
